definition: the Three Worlds (as proposed by Mao Zedong), i.e. the superpowers (USA and USSR), other wealthy countries (UK, France, Japan etc), and the developing countries of Asia, Africa and Latin America
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
Second World (Cold War-era term referring to communist nations as a bloc)

the four elements: earth, water, fire, and wind (Buddhism)/the four freedoms: speaking out freely, airing views fully, holding great debates, and writing big-character posters, 大鳴大放|大鸣大放[da4 ming2 da4 fang4], 大辯論|大辩论[da4 bian4 lun4], 大字報|大字报[da4 zi4 bao4] (PRC)
ranked number one in the world/the world's first
the two poles/the north and south poles/both ends of sth/electric or magnetic poles
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
sea land air (transport, or military operations)
time and place/world of a particular locale and era/(physics) space-time
